cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 525 mi SSE of Bermuda and 1170 mi ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic between Bermuda and the Bahamas, then forecast to turn northwest and approach the North/South Carolina coast late Wednesday–Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Fear / Wilmington, North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge and Hurricane watches expected to be issued Tuesday morning for portions of the North and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern and Mid-Atlantic U.S. coast from South Carolina through North Carolina and into Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely by early Thursday with a high chance (41–48%) of hurricane-force gusts (64-kt probabilities up to 48%) near landfall
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening storm surge expected along the North Carolina coast; values well above 3 ft are possible in the Cape Fear – Wilmington area
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rainfall capable of producing 10+ inch totals and freshwater flooding in coastal and inland eastern North Carolina
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, coastal inundation, and possible river flooding that could disrupt port operations
